settings.title: Web AI API Functionality Availability Test
settings.description: Manual context-menu trigger is always available. Auto-detect is opt-in and only runs on whitelisted pages. Extracted API keys are not saved by default.

contextMenu.enableDesc: Adds an “AI API Check” item to the browser context menu.

autoDetect.enableDesc: When enabled, the extension may detect credentials from copy actions and will ask for confirmation before opening the modal.

whitelist.patternsDesc: One JavaScript RegExp pattern per line. Case-insensitive match is applied. Invalid patterns are ignored (treated as non-matching).

success.settingsSaved: AI API Check settings have been saved.

confirmToast.title: Valid AI API URL and API Key Detected
confirmToast.body: Do you want to open the AI API test Panel to check and test the AI API's availability?

modal.title: AI API Functionality Availability Test

sourceText.label: Text to extract from
sourceText.placeholder: Paste a base URL and API key here, or use the context menu to prefill from selection.

errors.missingBaseUrlOrKey: Please provide base URL and API key first.
errors.runTestBeforeSave: Please run a test before saving.
errors.saveToProfilesFailed: Failed to save to API profiles.

hints.saveWithoutTest: Tip: you can save once base URL + API key are provided (no need to test or fetch models first). Testing is optional and only helps verify availability.

modal.privacyHint: API Keys will be considered sensitive information: hidden by default, and nothing is stored unless you choose to save to API profiles.
